name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Prince Edward Island research and records

choices.name: Get started with research for your Prince Edward Island ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about finding your ancestors in Prince Edward Island.

    ☆ FS Wiki:—Prince Edward Island—Finding Your Ancestors

  2. Explore resources for Prince Edward Island research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Prince Edward Island Resources

  3. Learn about records from Prince Edward Island.

    ☆ AA—Prince Edward Island Genealogy

  4. Use the Prince Edward Island Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Prince Edward Island Record Selection Table

  5. Explore a variety of records on the FreeCanadianAncestry site.
  6. Search for a variety of Prince Edward Island records on the Rootsweb site.

choices.name: Explore Prince Edward Island city directories.

content.text: 1. Explore city directories in Prince Edward Island on the CanGenealogy site.

content.text:
1. Learn about Prince Edward Island vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Prince Edward Island Vital Records
  2. Search for vital records on the Prince Edward Island Archives site.
  3. Learn about adoption records on the OriginsCanada site.

choices.name: Explore Prince Edward Island death records.

content.text:
1. Explore death record resources on the Death Indexes site.
  2. Explore Prince Edward Island obituaries on the In Memoriam site.

  2. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Prince Edward Island census records.

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore Prince Edward Island cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Prince Edward Island Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the Interment.net site for Prince Edward Island cemetery records.
  3. Browse the I Dream of Genealogy site for Prince Edward Island cemetery records.
  4. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  5. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

content.text:

  2. Learn about Acadian settlers in Prince Edward Island in this American Ancestors article.

name: Probate, Land and Court Records

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for probate and land records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Prince Edward Island probate records in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Prince Edward Island Probate Records

  2. Learn about Prince Edward Island land and property records.

    ☆ FS—Prince Edward Island Land and property Records

  3. Explore wills in the Prince Edward Island Wills database.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about Prince Edward Island maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: Explore Prince Edward Island maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. Explore the David Rumsey collection of Prince Edward Island maps.
  2. Explore the Canadiana maps collection.
  3. Explore the Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Prince Edward Island (search for Prince Edward Island on the page).
  4. Explore historical Prince Edward Island maps on the Historic Map Works site. Select North America, Canada, and Prince Edward Island in the drop-down menus.
  5. Find Prince Edward Island towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.
  6. Search for Prince Edward Island place names on the John Cardinal site.

name: Newspapers
section_name: Learn about Prince Edward Island newspapers.

choices.name: Learn about Prince Edward Island newspapers.

content.text:
1. Learn about Prince Edward Island newspapers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Prince Edward Island Newspapers

1. Explore Prince Edward Island newspaper resources on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Search Prince Edward Island newspapers in the onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search Prince Edward Island newspapers in the world-newspapers.com site.
  4. Search Prince Edward Island newspapers in the ABYZ News Link site.
  5. Explore Prince Edward Island newspaper resources on the Ancestor Hunt site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Prince Edward Island research.

content.text:
1. Explore links on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Explore links in Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in GenealogyLinks.net.

name: Search Records
section_name: Search records from Prince Edward Island.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks to quickly search record collections for Prince Edward Island.

content.text:
• QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  • QUIKLinks point to collections with 50,000 or more records.

1. Explore the FamilySearch page for online genealogy records.
  2. Explore additional record collections in Ancestry.
  3. Explore additional record collections in Findmypast.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Prince Edward Island research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Prince Edward Island Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Find additional Facebook pages for Prince Edward Island genealogy on the Genealogy on Facebook site.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Prince Edward Island research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Prince Edward Island research.
  2. Search the RootsWeb site for Prince Edward Island research mailing lists.
  3. Explore the Prince Edward Island research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.

choices.name: Learn about Prince Edward Island genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Prince Edward Island in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Prince Edward Island Societies

  2. Explore Prince Edward Island genealogy society sites on Cyndi's list.
  3. Get help at a family history center in Prince Edward Island.
